stem: For water flowing through a venturi, there is a proportional relationship between flow rate and differential pressure. stem: The most probable cause for fluctuating indication from a liquid flow rate differential pressure detector is... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.C: vortexing of the liquid passing through the flow device.

stem: A properly calibrated differential pressure-type water flow detector is located several feet below a horizontal pipe containing the detector's sensing element. stem: How will flow rate indication be affected if the equalizing valve for the associated differential pressure detector is fully opened? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

stem: A differential pressure flow detector is connected to a calibrated orifice in a cooling water system. Which one of the following will cause indicated volumetric flow rate to be lower than actual volumetric flow rate?

stem: What is the effect on a gas-filled neutron detector operating in the proportional region if the detector voltage is increased such that the detector operates closer to the high end of the proportional region?

choices.B: Essentially all of the ions from primary ionizations are collected; the number of ions collected from secondary ionizations is independent of the applied voltage.
choices.C: The number of ions collected from both primary and secondary ionizations varies directly with the applied voltage on a logarithmic scale.
choices.D: Essentially all of the ions from primary ionizations are collected; the number of ions collected from secondary ionizations varies directly with the applied voltage on a logarithmic scale.

stem: A boron trifluoride (BF ) detector (proportional counter) is normally used to monitor only source 3 range core neutron level. How will the detector and source range count rate indication be affected if normal detector high voltage is inadvertently applied during reactor operation in the power range? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The BF gas will become completely ionized and source range indication will stabilize at a 3 constant low value.
choices.B: The BF gas will become completely ionized and source range indication will stabilize at a 3 constant high value.
choices.C: The detector electrodes will become exposed to an extremely high neutron flux and cause a false high reading on the source range indication.
choices.D: The detector electrodes will become exposed to an extremely high gamma flux and cause a false high reading on the source range indication. -177- PWR Test Items

stem: A beta particle and an alpha particle enter and cause ionization in a gas-filled radiation detector operating in the Geiger-Mueller region. Which one of the following accurately compares the amplitude of the detector pulses caused by each type of radiation?

choices.A: The beta particle pulse will be larger in amplitude.
choices.B: The alpha particle pulse will be larger in amplitude.
choices.C: The pulses will be the same for both types of radiation.
choices.D: Cannot be determined without particle kinetic energy information.

stem: A nuclear power plant has been shut down for one month. A portable gas-filled radiation detector is needed to monitor shutdown reactor core neutron level from a location outside the reactor vessel. The detector must be able to distinguish between ionizations caused by gamma and neutron radiation. Which region(s) of the gas-filled detector characteristic curve is/are acceptable for operation of the detector? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Geiger-Mueller, Ion Chamber, and Proportional regions are all acceptable.
choices.B: Proportional region is acceptable, and Ion Chamber region also may be usable.
choices.C: Ion Chamber region is acceptable, and Geiger-Mueller region also may be usable.
choices.D: Geiger-Mueller region is acceptable, and Proportional region also may be usable. -178- PWR Test Items

stem: Quench gases are added to gas-filled radiation detectors that operate in the __________ region; the quench gases prevent a single ionization event from causing __________ in the detector gas volume.

choices.D: Geiger-Mueller; secondary ionizations

stem: Which one of the following contains the pair of radiation detector types that are the most sensitive to low-energy beta and/or gamma radiation? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Ion chamber and proportional -179- PWR Test Items

stem: A beta particle and an alpha particle with equal kinetic energies cause ionization in a gas-filled radiation detector. The detector is operating in the ion chamber region of the gas ionization curve. Which one of the following describes the amplitudes of the detector pulses caused by each type of radiation?

choices.A: The beta particle pulse will be larger in amplitude.
choices.B: The alpha particle pulse will be larger in amplitude.
choices.C: The amplitudes of both pulses will be approximately equal for all detector voltages in the ion chamber region.
choices.D: The amplitudes of both pulses will be approximately equal for all detector voltages in the ion chamber region, as well as all detector voltages outside the ion chamber region.

stem: Which one of the following types of radiation detectors is generally not used for measuring a high- intensity beta and gamma radiation field because of a relatively long detector recovery time, or dead time, following each ionization event? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Scintillation -180- PWR Test Items

stem: A proportional detector with pulse height discrimination circuitry is being used in a constant field of neutron and gamma radiation to provide source range neutron count rate indication. Assume that the pulse height discrimination setpoint does not change. If the detector voltage is increased but maintained within the proportional region, count rate indication will increase because...

choices.A: a single neutron- or gamma-induced ionizing event will result in multiple pulses inside the detector.
choices.B: the ratio of the number of neutron-induced pulses to gamma-induced pulses inside the detector will increase.
choices.C: the positive space charge effect will increase and promote the collection of both gamma- and neutron-induced pulses.
choices.D: all detector pulses will increase in amplitude and previously uncounted gamma pulses will be added to the total count rate.

stem: Which one of the following types of radiation detectors uses a gas volume for radiation detection and will typically produce the weakest output signal if all of the detectors are placed in the same gamma radiation field? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Scintillation -181- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following types of radiation detectors is typically the least accurate in determining the dose rate to a human body from an unspecified source of radiation?

choices.D: Scintillation

stem: A fission chamber neutron detector is located in a constant neutron radiation field and is initially operating in the proportional region. If the voltage applied to the detector is changed such that the detector operates in the ion chamber region, the rate of neutron interactions in the detector will __________; and the amplitude of each neutron-induced detector pulse will __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: remain the same; decrease -182- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes the positive space charge effect associated with a gas-filled radiation detector?

choices.A: Multiple detector pulses result from a single ionization event because positive ions form a cloud around the negative electrode, which increases the electric field strength, thereby initiating secondary ionizations.
choices.B: Multiple detector pulses result from a single ionization event because positive ions form a cloud around the positive electrode, which increases the electric field strength, thereby initiating secondary ionizations.
choices.C: The pulse amplitude resulting from an ionization event is reduced because positive ions form a cloud around the negative electrode, which reduces the electric field strength, thereby limiting secondary ionizations.
choices.D: The pulse amplitude resulting from an ionization event is reduced because positive ions form a cloud around the positive electrode, which reduces the electric field strength, thereby limiting secondary ionizations.

stem: In which usable region(s) of the gas-filled detector ionization curve is the pulse height resulting from the detection of a 1 MeV beta particle the same as a 5 MeV alpha particle? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Proportional and Ionization Chamber. -183- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following personal radiation monitoring devices can be charged with DC voltage to “zero” the device prior to use?

choices.D: Self-reading pocket dosimeter

stem: A Geiger-Mueller detector with a pancake probe (often called a frisker) is being used to monitor personnel leaving a radiologically controlled area. The probe is equipped with a mica window. Two individuals have radioactive skin contamination—one individual with only alpha emitters, and the other with only beta emitters. Both types of radiation are being emitted at the same rate. The same percentage of each type of radiation enters the probe’s detection chamber and causes ionization. Which one of the following describes the detector’s count rate response to the alpha and beta radiation? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The count rate will be higher for the alpha radiation.
choices.B: The count rate will be higher for the beta radiation.
choices.C: The count rate will be the same for both types of radiation.
choices.D: Cannot be determined without knowing the energy levels of the radiation. -184- PWR Test Items

stem: Just prior to a plant outage, the power range nuclear instruments (using excore detectors) were calibrated at 50 percent reactor power. During the outage, 40 fuel assemblies from the center of the core were exchanged with 40 higher enriched fuel assemblies from the outer portions of the core. No other fuel assemblies were affected. Immediately after the outage, when the reactor is stabilized at 50 percent power, indicated reactor power will be __________ than actual reactor power because neutron leakage from the core has __________.

choices.D: higher; increased

stem: A proportional detector with pulse height discrimination circuitry is being used in a constant field of neutron and gamma radiation to provide source range neutron count rate indication. Assume the pulse height discrimination threshold does not change. If the detector voltage is decreased significantly, but maintained within the proportional region, the detector count rate indication will __________; and the detector will become __________ susceptible to the positive space charge effect. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: remain the same: more -185- PWR Test Items

stem: A gas-filled radiation detector that operates in the Geiger-Mueller region of the gas ionization curve is being used in a constant radiation field. If the detector’s operating voltage is increased by 50 volts while remaining in the Geiger-Mueller region, the detector’s count rate indication will __________; and the ability of the detector to detect gamma radiation will __________.

choices.D: remain the same; remain the same

stem: A proportional detector with pulse height discrimination circuitry is being used in a constant field of neutron and gamma radiation to provide source range neutron count rate indication. Assume the pulse height discrimination value does not change. If the detector voltage is increased significantly, but maintained within the proportional region, the detector count rate indication will __________; and the detector will become __________ susceptible to the positive space charge effect. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: remain the same: more -186- PWR Test Items

stem: A fission chamber detector is initially operating in the proportional region to measure neutron flux in the source range. If the voltage applied to the detector is changed so that the detector now operates in the ion chamber region, the detector will produce __________ pulses; and will experience a __________ positive space charge effect.

choices.D: smaller; smaller

stem: A gas-filled radiation detector is operating in the proportional region with a count rate indication of 1.0 x 105 cpm in a constant radiation field. The detector does not have pulse height discrimination circuitry. If the detector’s operating voltage is increased by 20 percent while remaining in the proportional region, the total number of ions resulting from a single ionization within the detector will __________; and the detector count rate indication will __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: remain the same; remain the same -187- PWR Test Items

stem: Radiation interacting with a gas-filled radiation detector produces primary ion pairs. A primary ion pair consists of an electron and the ion formed by its removal. If the detector voltage is high enough, a primary ion pair can produce secondary ion pairs. When secondary ion pairs are formed, they are typically caused by interactions between the primary __________ and the __________ in the detector.

choices.D: electron; electrodes

stem: A typical gamma ray (1 to 2 MeV) normally produces a free electron in a gas-filled radiation detector by… NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: transferring energy to a nucleus, which recoils and leaves behind a free electron.
choices.B: transferring energy to a bound electron, which recoils and becomes a free electron.
choices.C: entering the electrostatic field of a nucleus, where it transforms into a proton and a free electron.
choices.D: entering the electrostatic field of a bound electron, where it transforms into a positron and a free electron. -188- PWR Test Items

stem: A typical alpha particle produces free electrons in a gas-filled radiation detector primarily by…

choices.D: electrostatic attraction of bound electrons.

stem: Which one of the following describes a characteristic of a self-reading pocket dosimeter (SRPD)? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The output of an SRPD is a dose rate in mR/hr.
choices.B: SRPDs are primarily sensitive to beta radiation.
choices.C: SRPD readings must be considered inaccurate when they are dropped.
choices.D: SRPDs hold their charge indefinitely when removed from a radiation field. -189- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following types of radiation is the major contributor to the dose indication on a self-reading pocket dosimeter (SRPD)?

choices.D: Neutron

stem: Which one of the following describes a characteristic of a self-reading pocket dosimeter? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Provides dose rate indication in mR/hr.
choices.B: More sensitive to gamma radiation than beta radiation.
choices.C: Contains crystals that luminesce when exposed to ionizing radiation.
choices.D: Can be stored as an accurate record of lifetime radiation exposure. -190- PWR Test Items

stem: A nuclear plant worker normally wears a thermoluminescent dosimeter (TLD) or similar device for measuring radiation exposure. When a self-reading pocket dosimeter (SRPD) is also required, where will the SRPD be worn and why?

choices.A: Below the waist near the TLD to measure radiation from the same source(s).
choices.B: Below the waist away from the TLD to measure radiation from different sources.
choices.C: Above the waist near the TLD to measure radiation from the same source(s).
choices.D: Above the waist away from the TLD to measure radiation from different sources.

stem: A Geiger-Mueller detector with a pancake probe (often called a frisker) is being used to monitor workers leaving a radiologically controlled area for contamination. The probe is equipped with a mica window. The background detector count rate is 20 cpm. As one worker’s shoe is scanned, the count rate increases to 200 cpm. When a sheet of paper is placed between the probe and the shoe, the count rate decreases to 60 cpm. Which one of the following is indicated by the decrease in the count rate? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.C: The contamination does not contain beta particles.
choices.D: The contamination does not contain alpha particles. -191- PWR Test Items

stem: A Geiger Mueller detector with a pancake probe (sometimes called a frisker) is being used to monitor for skin contamination. During frisking, the probe is more likely to detect contamination if the probe is held __________ than one-half inch from the skin; and is moved __________ than two inches per second.

choices.D: closer; slower

stem: A nuclear plant worker normally wears a thermoluminescent dosimeter (TLD) or similar device for measuring whole body radiation exposure. When a self-reading pocket dosimeter (SRPD) is also required for whole body monitoring, where will the SRPD be worn and why? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Near the TLD to add exposure to the TLD measurement.
choices.B: Near the TLD to measure radiation affecting the same part of the body.
choices.C: Away from the TLD to add exposure to the TLD measurement.
choices.D: Away from the TLD to measure radiation affecting a different part of the body. -192- PWR Test Items

stem: A Geiger-Mueller detector with a pancake probe is being used to monitor workers leaving a radiologically controlled area for contamination. The probe is sensitive to alpha, beta, and gamma radiation. The background count rate is 20 cpm. As one worker’s shoe is scanned the count rate increases to 1,000 cpm. Given the following separate actions:  When a sheet of paper is placed between the probe and the shoe, the count rate decreases to 600 cpm.  When a sheet of aluminum foil is placed between the probe and the shoe, the count rate decreases to 600 cpm. Which one of the following lists the type(s) of radiation being emitted by the contamination? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Alpha and gamma -193- PWR Test Items

stem: A Geiger-Mueller detector with a pancake probe is being used to monitor workers leaving a radiologically controlled area for contamination. The probe is sensitive to alpha, beta, and gamma radiation. The background count rate is 20 cpm. As one worker’s shoe is scanned, the count rate increases to 1,000 cpm. Given the following separate actions:  When a sheet of paper is placed between the probe and the shoe, the count rate decreases to 400 cpm.  When a sheet of aluminum foil is placed between the probe and the shoe, the count rate decreases to 20 cpm. The results of the above actions indicate that the radiation from the shoe contamination consists of… NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: alpha, beta, and gamma. -194- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes the ion collection that occurs in a proportional counter, such as a BF detector? 3

choices.A: A fraction of the ions created by primary ionizations are collected. No secondary ionizations take place.
choices.B: Virtually all of the ions created by primary ionizations are collected. No secondary ionizations take place.
choices.C: Virtually all of the ions created by primary ionizations along with a fraction of the ions created by secondary ionizations are collected.
choices.D: Virtually all of the ions created by primary and secondary ionizations are collected.

stem: A fission chamber neutron monitoring instrument is operating in the proportional region. If a complete loss of fission chamber gas pressure occurs, the instrument indication will fail... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: to midscale. -195- PWR Test Items

stem: During reactor power operation, a reactor coolant sample is taken and analyzed. Which one of the following lists three radionuclides that are all indicative of a fuel cladding failure if detected in elevated concentrations in the reactor coolant sample?

choices.D: Hydrogen-2, hydrogen-3, and oxygen-18

stem: During power operation, a reactor coolant sample is taken and analyzed. Which one of the following lists three nuclides that are all indicative of a possible fuel cladding failure if found to be at elevated concentrations in the reactor coolant sample? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Hydrogen-2, hydrogen-3, and nitrogen-16 -196- PWR Test Items
